com.sun.tools.visualvm.application.jvm

Class Jvm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sun.tools.visualvm.core.model.Model
      • com.sun.tools.visualvm.application.jvm.Jvm

  • public abstract class Jvm
extends Model
    This class encapsulates functionality of the target Java application. Use JvmFactory.getJVMFor(Application ) to get instance of Jvm class.
    Author:
    Tomas Hurka

      • PROPERTY_DUMP_OOME_ENABLED

        public static final String PROPERTY_DUMP_OOME_ENABLED
        Property name for isDumpOnOOMEnabled(). If property dumpOnOOMEnabled changes its state, property change is fired with this property name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isAttachable

        public abstract boolean isAttachable()
        Tests if VisualVM can attach to target JVM via Attach API.
        Returns:
        true if VisualVM can attach to target JVMvia Attach API, false otherwise

      • isBasicInfoSupported

        public abstract boolean isBasicInfoSupported()
        Tests if target JVM supports getting basic JVM informations. This includes getCommandLine(), getJvmArgs(), getJvmFlags(), getMainClass(), getVmVersion(), getJavaHome(), getVMInfo(), getVMName() methods.
        Returns:
        true if target JVM supports basic JVM information, false otherwise

      • getCommandLine

        public abstract String getCommandLine()
        Return the command line for the target Java application.
        Returns:
        Returns the command line of the target Java application.

      • getJvmArgs

        public abstract String getJvmArgs()
        Return the JVM arguments for the target Java application.
        Returns:
        Returns the arguments passed to the JVM for the target Java application

      • getJvmFlags

        public abstract String getJvmFlags()
        Return the JVM flags for the target Java application.
        Returns:
        Returns the flags passed to the JVM for the target Java application

      • getMainArgs

        public abstract String getMainArgs()
        Return the arguments to the main class for the target Java application.
        Returns:
        Returns the arguments to the main class.

      • getMainClass

        public abstract String getMainClass()
        Return the main class for the target Java application or the name of the jar file if the application was started with the -jar option.
        Returns:
        Returns the main class of the target Java application or the name of the jar file.

      • getVmVersion

        public abstract String getVmVersion()
        Returns the VM version for the target Java application.
        Returns:
        Returns the version of the target Java application

      • getJavaVersion

        public abstract String getJavaVersion()
        Returns the Java version for the target Java application.
        Returns:
        Returns the Java version of the target Java application
        Since:
        1.3.1

      • getJavaHome

        public abstract String getJavaHome()
        Returns the java.home property for the target Java application. "java.home" property specify the directory into which the JRE was installed.
        Returns:
        Returns java.home property.

      • getVmInfo

        public abstract String getVmInfo()
        Returns the java.vm.info property for the target Java application. the java.vm.info property (which is reflected in the text displayed by "java -version")
        Returns:
        Returns java.vm.info property.

      • getVmName

        public abstract String getVmName()
        Returns the java.vm.name property for the target Java application. java.vm.name property is Java Virtual Machine implementation name.
        Returns:
        Returns java.vm.name property.

      • getVmVendor

        public abstract String getVmVendor()
        Returns the java.vm.vendor property for the target Java application. java.vm.vendor property is Java Virtual Machine vendor name.
        Returns:
        Returns java.vm.vendor property.

      • isMonitoringSupported

        public abstract boolean isMonitoringSupported()
        Tests if target JVM monitoring is supported. If true, JVM fires MonitoredDataListener.monitoredDataEvent(MonitoredData )
        Returns:
        true if JVM is supports monitoring, false otherwise

      • isClassMonitoringSupported

        public abstract boolean isClassMonitoringSupported()
        Tests if target JVM supports class monitoring. If true, methods getLoadedClasses(), getSharedLoadedClasses(), getSharedUnloadedClasses(), getUnloadedClasses() from MonitoredData returns meaningful data.
        Returns:
        true if JVM supports class monitoring, false otherwise

      • isThreadMonitoringSupported

        public abstract boolean isThreadMonitoringSupported()
        Tests if target JVM supports thread monitoring. If true, methods getThreadsDaemon(), getThreadsLive(), getThreadsLivePeak(), getThreadsStarted() from MonitoredData returns meaningful data.
        Returns:
        true if JVM supports thread monitoring, false otherwise

      • isMemoryMonitoringSupported

        public abstract boolean isMemoryMonitoringSupported()
        Tests if target JVM supports thread monitoring. If true, methods getGenCapacity(), getGenUsed(), getGenMaxCapacity() from MonitoredData returns meaningful data.
        Returns:
        true if JVM supports memory monitoring, false otherwise

      • isCpuMonitoringSupported

        public abstract boolean isCpuMonitoringSupported()
        Tests if target JVM supports process CPU time monitoring. If true, methods getProcessCpuTime() from MonitoredData returns meaningful data.
        Returns:
        true if JVM supports process CPU time monitoring, false otherwise

      • isCollectionTimeSupported

        public abstract boolean isCollectionTimeSupported()
        Tests if target JVM supports Garbage collection time monitoring. If true, methods getCollectionTime() from MonitoredData returns meaningful data.
        Returns:
        true if JVM supports Garbage collection time monitoring, false otherwise

      • addMonitoredDataListener

        public abstract void addMonitoredDataListener(MonitoredDataListener l)
        Adds a MonitoredDataListener to the listener list.
        Parameters:
        l - the MonitoredDataListener to be added

      • removeMonitoredDataListener

        public abstract void removeMonitoredDataListener(MonitoredDataListener l)
        Removes a MonitoredDataListener to the listener list.
        Parameters:
        l - the MonitoredDataListener to be removed

      • getGenName

        public abstract String[] getGenName()
        Returns the names of Java virtual machine spaces.
        Returns:
        Index 0 is the display name for heap, index 1 is display name for Permanent Generation (PermGen)
        Since:
        VisualVM 1.3.6

      • isGetSystemPropertiesSupported

        public abstract boolean isGetSystemPropertiesSupported()
        Tests if it is possible to obtain system properties from target JVM.
        Returns:
        true if JVM supports system properties, false otherwise

      • getSystemProperties

        public abstract Properties getSystemProperties()
        Returns a map of names and values of all system properties of target JVM.
        Returns:
        a map of names and values of all system properties.

      • isDumpOnOOMEnabledSupported

        public abstract boolean isDumpOnOOMEnabledSupported()
        Tests if it is possible to set HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError flag in target JVM.
        Returns:
        true if JVM supports setting of HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError flag, false otherwise

      • isDumpOnOOMEnabled

        public abstract boolean isDumpOnOOMEnabled()
        Gets value of HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError flag from target JVM.
        Returns:
        returns value of HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError flag.

      • setDumpOnOOMEnabled

        public abstract void setDumpOnOOMEnabled(boolean enabled)
        sets HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError flag on target JVM.
        Parameters:
        enabled - new value of HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError flag

      • isTakeHeapDumpSupported

        public abstract boolean isTakeHeapDumpSupported()
        Tests if it is possible to obtain heap dump from target JVM.
        Returns:
        true if JVM supports heap dump, false otherwise

      • takeHeapDump

        public abstract File takeHeapDump()
                           throws IOException
        Takes heap dump of target JVM.
        Returns:
        returns File where heap dump is stored.
        Throws:
        IOException - I/O error

      • isTakeThreadDumpSupported

        public abstract boolean isTakeThreadDumpSupported()
        Tests if it is possible to obtain thread dump from target JVM.
        Returns:
        true if JVM supports thread dump, false otherwise

      • takeThreadDump

        public abstract File takeThreadDump()
                             throws IOException
        Takes thread dump of target JVM.
        Returns:
        Returns String of the thread dump from target JVM.
        Throws:
        IOException - i/O error

      • takeHeapHistogram

        public HeapHistogram takeHeapHistogram()
        Takes heap histogram of target Application.
        Returns:
        Returns HeapHistogram of the heap from target Application.
        Since:
        VisualVM 1.3.7

      • getMonitoredData

        public abstract MonitoredData getMonitoredData()
        provides access to current values of monitored data in instance of MonitoredData. The methods may return null if the MonitoredData are not available or are not supported by particular Jvm instance.
        Returns:
        instance of MonitoredData with current values of monitored data or null if the monitored data cannot be retrieved.
        Since:
        VisualVM 1.2

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public final void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Add a PropertyChangeListener to the listener list. The listener is registered for all properties. The same listener object may be added more than once, and will be called as many times as it is added. If listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        listener - The PropertyChangeListener to be added

      • removePropertyChangeListener

        public final void removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Remove a PropertyChangeListener from the listener list. This removes a PropertyChangeListener that was registered for all properties. If listener was added more than once to the same event source, it will be notified one less time after being removed. If listener is null, or was never added, no exception is thrown and no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        listener - The PropertyChangeListener to be removed

      • firePropertyChange

        protected final void firePropertyChange(String propertyName,
                      Object oldValue,
                      Object newValue)
        Report a bound property update to any registered listeners. No event is fired if old and new are equal and non-null.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The programmatic name of the property that was changed.
        oldValue - The old value of the property.
        newValue - The new value of the property.
